title: Celery Root and Pear Remoulade with Walnuts
summary: Celery Root and Pear Remoulade with Walnuts could be just the gluten free, dairy free, and whole 30 recipe you've been looking for. This recipe serves 6. This side dish has 438 calories, 6g of protein, and 37g of fat per serving. For $1.77 per serving, this recipe covers 14% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from Food and Wine requires hard-cooked egg, lemon juice, cornichons, and salt and pepper. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 45%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes include Creamy Celery Root Remoulade with Walnuts, Céleri-rave Rémoulade (celery Root Rémoulade), and Celery Root Rémoulade.
instructions: In a heavy glass or ceramic bowl, whisk the egg yolks with the water, mustard and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Whisk in the oil in small drops until the sauce starts to thicken, then whisk in the remaining oil in a thin, steady stream; when all of the oil has been added, the sauce should be thick. Whisk in 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice. Fold in the egg, cornichons, capers, parsley, tarragon and garlic. Season with salt and pepper and refrigerate.                                              Preheat the oven to 400. In a cake pan, toast the walnuts for about 4 minutes, or until fragrant and deep brown.                                              Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to a boil. Shred the celery root on the largest holes of a box grater and toss immediately with 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice. Add 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice to the saucepan, then add the celery root and blanch until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Drain the celery root and plunge it into a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. Drain again and pat thoroughly dry.                                              Grate the pears into a bowl and toss with the remaining 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Add the celery root, remoulade sauce and walnuts and toss well. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the celery leaves and serve.

steps.step: In a heavy glass or ceramic bowl, whisk the egg yolks with the water, mustard and a pinch each of salt and pepper.
Whisk in the oil in small drops until the sauce starts to thicken, then whisk in the remaining oil in a thin, steady stream; when all of the oil has been added, the sauce should be thick.
Whisk in 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice. Fold in the egg, cornichons, capers, parsley, tarragon and garlic. Season with salt and pepper and refrigerate.
In a cake pan, toast the walnuts for about 4 minutes, or until fragrant and deep brown.
Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to a boil. Shred the celery root on the largest holes of a box grater and toss immediately with 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice.
Add 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice to the saucepan, then add the celery root and blanch until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes.
Drain the celery root and plunge it into a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking.
Drain again and pat thoroughly dry.
Grate the pears into a bowl and toss with the remaining 1 tablespoon of lemon juice.
Add the celery root, remoulade sauce and walnuts and toss well. Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with the celery leaves and serve.
